div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 355 Ishtib (mod. Stip), S. Serbia, Yugo- (495) slavia, c. 1912 Burial: c. 500 B.C. (T) Contents: AR Macedonian tribes (mostly Derrones): octadr. Disposition: New York 3 (1 Derrones, 1 Bisaltae, 1 Orrescii) and casts of a few others possibly from the same hd.; Berlin 1 or 2; Belgrade 1; private coll. Greece 1; Jameson 1946, 1948; Pozzi 708; Egger Jan. 15, 1912, 235 BlM 1913, p. 5411, illus. (1 Berlin coin)* Svoronos, JIAN 1919, pp. 9-10, 12-3, 25, some illus. Saria, NZ 1927, p. 12, illus. (1 Belgrade coin) * The 2 octadr. cited in the BlM as part of the Kaliandra 1913 hd., no. 358 below, otherwise containing only Mende tetradr., almost certainly belong to the find from Ishtib and were probably confused with coins from the Kaliandra hd. by Ritsos who acquired a major portion of both finds
